p.q0: After having been working on the topic "daily routines" for some sessions, Guillermo wants his students to develop their oral fluency on that topic. He puts the students in pairs and gives each pair a picture of a famous singer. He asks them to take turns describing the singer's daily routine. While monitoring, the teacher notices that a couple of students say the following sentences: "He is get up at 10:00 am" and "He don't have to work."
p.q: Given that situation, which strategy is it appropriate for Guillermo to carry out?

as.a: Kindly, interrupt the two students and indicate their errors. Then give them a short explanation about the correct use of the simple present tense.
Don't make any comments on the students' mistakes and let them finish. Then, when the activity is over, remind all the students how the simple present tense is formed.
Approach each student that has problems using the simple present tense. Echo the student's sentence emphasizing the problem and ask him to say the sentence again.
